segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe).
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe).

segment.source: Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe).
segment.target: Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe).

segment.source: The Microsoft Protection Service, which is used by Windows Firewall, is an integral part of the computer’s threat protection against malware.
segment.target: The Microsoft Protection Service, which is used by Windows Firewall, is an integral part of the computer’s threat protection against malware.

segment.source: Active policies when the Windows Firewall service starts.
segment.target: Active policies when the Windows Firewall service starts.

segment.source: Changes to the Windows Firewall exception list.
segment.target: Changes to the Windows Firewall exception list.

segment.source: Rules ignored or not applied by the Windows Firewall service.
segment.target: Rules ignored or not applied by the Windows Firewall service.

segment.source: Changes to Windows Firewall Group Policy settings.
segment.target: Changes to Windows Firewall Group Policy settings.

segment.source: Changes to firewall rules are important for understanding the security state of the computer and how well it is protected against network attacks.
segment.target: Changes to firewall rules are important for understanding the security state of the computer and how well it is protected against network attacks.

segment.source: Success events shows you changes in Windows Firewall rules and settings, active configuration and rules after Windows Firewall Service startup and default configuration restore actions.
segment.target: Success events shows you changes in Windows Firewall rules and settings, active configuration and rules after Windows Firewall Service startup and default configuration restore actions.

segment.source: Failure events may help to identify configuration problems with Windows Firewall rules or settings.
segment.target: Failure events may help to identify configuration problems with Windows Firewall rules or settings.

segment.source: 4944(S): The following policy was active when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: 4944(S): The following policy was active when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: 4945(S): A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.
segment.target: 4945(S): A rule was listed when the Windows Firewall started.

segment.source: 4946(S): A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list.
segment.target: 4946(S): A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list.

segment.source: 4947(S): A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list.
segment.target: 4947(S): A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list.

segment.source: 4948(S): A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list.
segment.target: 4948(S): A change has been made to Windows Firewall exception list.

segment.source: 4949(S): Windows Firewall settings were restored to the default values.
segment.target: 4949(S): Windows Firewall settings were restored to the default values.

segment.source: 4950(S): A Windows Firewall setting has changed.
segment.target: 4950(S): A Windows Firewall setting has changed.

segment.source: 4951(F): A rule has been ignored because its major version number was not recognized by Windows Firewall.
segment.target: 4951(F): A rule has been ignored because its major version number was not recognized by Windows Firewall.

segment.source: 4952(F): Parts of a rule have been ignored because its minor version number was not recognized by Windows Firewall.
segment.target: 4952(F): Parts of a rule have been ignored because its minor version number was not recognized by Windows Firewall.

segment.source: The other parts of the rule will be enforced.
segment.target: The other parts of the rule will be enforced.

segment.source: 4953(F): A rule has been ignored by Windows Firewall because it could not parse the rule.
segment.target: 4953(F): A rule has been ignored by Windows Firewall because it could not parse the rule.

segment.source: 4954(S): Windows Firewall Group Policy settings have changed.
segment.target: 4954(S): Windows Firewall Group Policy settings have changed.

segment.source: The new settings have been applied.
segment.target: The new settings have been applied.

segment.source: 4956(S): Windows Firewall has changed the active profile.
segment.target: 4956(S): Windows Firewall has changed the active profile.

segment.source: 4957(F): Windows Firewall did not apply the following rule:
segment.target: 4957(F): Windows Firewall did not apply the following rule:

segment.source: 4958(F): Windows Firewall did not apply the following rule because the rule referred to items not configured on this computer:
segment.target: 4958(F): Windows Firewall did not apply the following rule because the rule referred to items not configured on this computer:
